alert.note: Alert for Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 4:49PM EST until January 01 at 6:24PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In South Central Ohio, Adams and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 PM EST, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, New Boston, Vanceburg, Greenup, South Webster, Camp Dix, Rome, Head of Grassy, Rosemount, Franklin Furnace, Sciotodale, Clarktown, Tollesboro, Garrison, Rexton, Tannery, Buena Vista in Scioto County and Saint Paul.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
